document.title: Georgia Standards of Excellence CTEA Business, Management and Administration

C97C874881084823B0262350A5600EC1.description: Explore the competitive events related to the content of this course and the required competencies, skills, and knowledge for each related event for individual, team, and chapter competitions.

B16702FA12C0426B8F12DE56C8E9B4CF.description: Explain how participation in career and technology education student organizations can promote lifelong responsibility for community service and professional development.

0A50BFF548944B37BEC00792621017CE.description: Explore the local, state, and national opportunities available to students through participation in related student organization (FBLA) including but not limited to conferences, competitions, community service, philanthropy, and other FBLA activities.

7CE532EBABE549C4BA485379FCCE4197.description: Explore the impact and opportunities a student organization (FBLA) can develop to bring business and education together in a positive working relationship through innovative leadership and career development programs.

81C6DD2EE2254A239CD454D3B6FCE77E.description: Explain the goals, mission, and objectives of Future Business Leaders of America.

AE076D0A68774828BE423186D0623D2D.description: Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology education courses through leadership development, school and community service projects, entrepreneurship development, and competitive events.

ED324DC87C584A0B97BA756DBE8F1CF0.description: Utilize financial software tools to draw conclusions and demonstrate an understanding of global economic activities.

C24E4CF43BDD45BEA6DC042E5C94AFFE.description: Compare and contrast absolute advantage and comparative advantage within international business.

9BB896856A94455A9C82B9475B2957AB.description: Analyze why and when exchange rates change, some groups benefit to these changes, and when some groups or countries may lose during financial fluctuations.

C3DC5C11D63243E7A8E817DB32E0D161.description: Develop an argument about the exchange rate as the price of one nation's currency in terms of another nation's currency.

C5AFCE54595D40E28062F60F395248AA.description: Interpret information from exchange rate formulas and charts.

A2768DE868F44D92AF4DA9D027B9D8B3.description: Compare and contrast developed and developing countries and their use of different types of currency, trade status, and international impacts on world markets.

1D172CD9688745CBB53803D6DB11FCB7.description: Compare and contrast economic concepts as they relate to international business.

5ADC97D826D54ACAB11D58628B3815F3.description: Identify international environmental concerns, how international businesses addresses those concerns, and how this might contrast with United States regulations and ethical behavior.

62B1D3A73EF341249F1A36789E44AFCB.description: Demonstrate an awareness and multiple ways that labor laws differ significantly from country to country.

74B6D0E6A4944AE29445885AD61E6E4A.description: Develop a logical argument for the need to follow a business's required ethical behavior regardless of the behavior of an international global market.

CFBDC4B9B3B64B43A67C6E53573A6278.description: Compare and contrast ethical and unethical behavior in various countries.

F32F9C32EAA54A42BB9F4533DE81474B.description: Explore strategies for managing ethical behavior globally.

0051140B93104AD78439C50DD5FCBE56.description: Recognize the need for ethical business behavior in a global business environment.

AC402FBB6DD64FF6B27DFEC2B3BE26E4.description: Use appropriate technology to plan, develop, practice, and present material to different types of audiences for specific business purpose.

C8D59708EEDB499BB523C980A6C3003A.description: Research and evaluate the impact of both verbal and nonverbal communications affecting international business relationships and negotiations and how it might contrast with the United States.

1C46D7B72B5B4EF7BBAE871E158FC2BB.description: Recognize and assess complications involved when speaking, writing, or interpreting a language incorrectly.

75D9E658ED584791B74366E6AFDCBE96.description: Demonstrate appropriate etiquette in communication in a multicultural and multigenerational international business environment.

7BF8B25C376C404E8D546EFDFEDF9732.description: Identify and model best practices in customer service for specific or multiple international business settings.

F43FF659F6A341EFB479EDB8A829845D.description: Create visual communication models that work to overcome language and generational barriers, such as customer service, project management, mediation, and related areas.

6F487595A6474BCFADAFE54524D7A48C.description: Develop and critique written communications that utilize proper tone, grammar, and biasfree language for the workplace.

F13F2A17FF1943B89199798821E609DE.description: Classify essential social media etiquette requirements and the importance of digital presence in business and international business representations.

C2848829C02F4032BEC9009F302F23DA.description: Demonstrate appropriate business (oral, written, visual, and digital) communication skills needed in the workplace to facilitate effective information and communication sharing.

C26964A0B8D24C229AD44E5F738AC819.description: Apply communication strategies necessary and appropriate for effective and profitable international business relations.

8276C576E10447A4A87591DA7EC31911.description: Define and investigate the role of importing, exporting, and trade relations.

ABB25C6232BD477C83E341732AAD6A0B.description: Identify and analyze social, historical, and cultural factors that affect business and international business activities.

F66D1B1DAFD648F3B1F0E67EA88CF486.description: Explore: culture, multiculturalism, stereotyping, cultural, generational, and other biases and their effects on conducting business internationally from an inward and outward perspective.

844450A55C2E4A8782B6D2D6DF7F25DB.description: Compare and contrast the top ten major global business centers, their successes, common traits, and characteristics of effective international business.

7C3FD8FB6FF044D889320619DDC64183.description: Analyze and describe the characteristics of effective international business approaches and various business types.

409DC303A45646C081957570C3E5B509.description: Make observations towards the interrelatedness and diversity of geographic, social, cultural, political, and legal factors and how they shape the international business environment.

3BA5A3480BAC43718451FD8BE76F5A20.description: Utilize technology in a variety of ways while solving business problems such as time management, project development, and resource allocations in international business.

FD6ADC7AEC6549479B3C45635816399F.description: Compare and contrast the pros and cons of sole proprietorship, partnership, and corporation in international business.

6EF50F1D2E384CA2BE0469027B0B63DC.description: Analyze and describe the characteristics of effective vision and mission statements created to lead an international business.

2B36C8B934E0443892516E39ED84D86E.description: Collect and summarize the necessary parts to an effective vision and mission statement.

B69505208070400B99D351856E248FD6.description: Predict the outcomes of management styles used in business and international business settings to appropriate styles and personal traits needed to effectively lead an organization.

08A36E969B2E428C804A55AA18B3329D.description: Identify the different types of management styles used in business and international business settings.

45B349DC73DE4C06A8838516A42236C9.description: Summarize from multiple sources the essential management styles, outcomes, vision statements, and needed personality traits used in international business settings.

BAF29D0D466840B68CCE08D1F9C3B97E.description: Investigate how global markets, prices, and competition influence economic behavior.

1008F5F511154C6F992945B9D9C5EF0A.description: Illustrate how rational decision-making and root cause analysis entails comparing the marginal benefits and the marginal costs of an action.

10FB33F919E64F408B15EEDD23725860.description: Analyze how profits are made, including how to interpret a profit and loss statement which may include the following elements: labor relations, labor shortages, unemployment, unionization, warranties, supply chain, forecasting, and adjustments.

1CAA8357F0164A60B7EE2F75102CEB55.description: Examine and describe how the Law of Demand, the Law of Supply, prices, and profits work together to determine production and distribution in a global market economy.

182124CE75054606A6D7A027E9EC7801.description: Compare and contrast the relationships between the functions of business: accounting, finance, production, marketing, sales, management, quality, human resources, customer service, and supply chain.

A61FC7FAB3484BC987A448F0C2D71B9E.description: Collect and compare fundamental business concepts that affect business and international business decision making.

29772A423B2C4318BDACFD16ABBC34E0.description: Summarize previous inventory results to describe ideas about self to international dimensions such as: travel, art, music, food, and language.

B01020CE7E9A43968FD415D5CC537A3F.description: Analyze and describe effective interpersonal communication in an international business work setting.

3E5F72E3368E4663B49D002974A09821.description: Demonstrate the ability to articulate and critique interests, values, personal traits, communication styles, and behaviors as relatable to an international business career.

5EF279A66B714E9981F3041892292D7E.description: Compare and contrast strengths and weaknesses as related to personal strengths, weaknesses, and personality traits through inventory assessment results.

DD24B3BD50E54023870E4F3973BE43C5.description: Assess self-interests, values, communication styles, and personalities through the use of personality inventories.

C43827DBF749441F8CEC5D6CF53BC00C.description: Summarize personal strengths, weaknesses, and personality traits through the completion of different types of assessments.

A6AE80F9BDA5460D816FB840906CBF0E.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

EB68E9197DF448ECB730DB46D3FDCC9E.description: Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to be able to work independently and apply team-work skills.

38AEC75E5D994EC4A613B5AA45CD0FFC.description: Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty, accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

F5DDBEACA1404A789C3679E1DA4D095A.description: Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in career planning and employment situations.

59DB33A329CA40EC8A1AB3C1F89F069F.description: Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and methods.

BE62D1FD26764EDEA18D5C82F02A1371.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

794F8AEB9D09410189C31BDAB1C5D66B.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
